sentence 1: Alice was dusting the living room and trying to find the button that Mama had hidden. No time today to look at old pictures in her favorite photo album. Today she had to hunt for a button, so she put the album on a chair without even opening it. [SEP] sentence 2: She put the album on a chair without even opening the living room.

sentence 1: I sat there feeling rather like a chappie I'd once read about in a book, who murdered another cove and hid the body under the dining-room table, and then had to be the life and soul of a dinner party, with it there all the time. [SEP] sentence 2: He had to be the life and soul of a dinner party, with the body there all the time.
